DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Agent Flow Rate Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The flow rate of the intravenous contrast agent expressed in cc/sec.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._The speed of movement of a liquid.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: The speed of movement of a liquid.

Concepts.definition: The speed of movement of a liquid.
